item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)

Yarīm ʾAyman and Bārig Yuharḥib,
sons of ʾAwslāt Rashūfān of the lineage of Hamdān,
lords of the house of Hirrān, qayls of the tribe of
Samʿī, the third of Ḥāshidum, have dedicated to
their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum, lord of
Turʿat six statues for their well-being
and the well-being of their households and of their tribe of Ḥā-
shidum, and of their land. And may he i.e. Taʾlab grant them
crops and good yields in their valleys
and their land. And may he grant them the es-
teem and good-pleasure of their lord, Wahabʾīl
Yaḥūz, King of Sabaʾ. And may he humiliate and annihilate
all of their enemies and their foes and safe-
guard them from the malice and enmity of any foe.
And may Taʾlab continue to maintain their soundness of mind
and their material resources. By Taʾlab Riyāmum!
